bibl.title: Letter from W.O. Reed to Jefferson Randolph Kean, January 12, 1918

div1.p: Reed informs Kean of an incident involving two privates in the ambulance service, Army Medical Corps.

div1.head: Letter from W.O. Reed to Jefferson Randolph Kean, January 12, 1918
div1.opener:
Reed Jan 19th 1918
January 12, 1918.
From: Major W. O. Reed, G. S.
To: Colonel Jefferson R. Kean, Medical Corps, A.E.F., A.P.O.702.
Subject: Privates Wuensch and Ranft.
div1.p:
1. Recently a German officer, Carl Sculler, 28th Regiment Strasstrub,
was captured. In his pocket-book was found the following addresses:

Rudolph F. Wuensch, 209 Avenue E, Rochester, N.Y., U. S. A.
Mr. Henry Ranft, 1183 Carlton R. D., East Cleveland, Ohio, U.S.A.

We find that both Wuensch and Ranft are privates in Section No. 81 Ambulance
Service. Their station is believed to be Sandricourt. They arrived in
France with their Section on September 20, 1917.

2. It is requested that you forward this letter in the most confidential
manner to the immediate commanding officer of these two men that he may
quietly keep them under survillance and report anything he may ascertain
as to their disloyalty direct to Intelligence Section B, Headquarters, A.
E. F.
div1.closer:
W. O. REED,
Major, G. S. Referred in Confidential letter to Lt Ellis see 591
